snippet.title: Helicopter crashes into power lines
snippet.content: BREAKING: A helicopter with two occupants has crashed into power lines near Cloncurry in northwest Queensland. Emergency crews including firefighters and ambulance officers are rushing to the scene. The helicopter is believed to have clipped power lines and crashed. The incident was reported about 7.40am today. The crash took place north of Cloncurry near Sedan Dip Road. A fire has reportedly broken out at the scene of the crash. The helicopter was believed to have been involved in a mustering operation before clipping power lines and crashing. A second helicopter nearby is reportedly en route to a nearby station to gather firefighting equipment. Originally published as
